title: Covid: Pfizer and AstraZeneca jabs effective against Indian variant - study
description: They are effective against symptomatic disease but protection is low after only one dose, a study says.

title: Covid-19: More than 50m vaccine doses given in England
description: The health secretary hails the milestone as 32 and 33-year-olds are offered the jab.

title: Covid vaccine: 32 and 33-year-olds in England now invited to book
description: People will get texts inviting them to book, as areas hit by the Indian variant look to jab over-18s.

title: Contaminated blood inquiry: 'I want their voices to be heard' - Hancock
description: Thousands of people died after being given infected blood products during the 70s and 80s.

title: Covid: Stillbirth and prematurity risks may be higher in pregnancy
description: The overall risks remain low for pregnant women but coronavirus may increase stillbirths, a study suggests.

title: PIP implant victims 'elated' by compensation win
description: Women who had the breast implants say they are delighted by the "victory" after 10 years fighting for justice.

title: Covid: Test and Trace failure helped Indian variant spread, report says
description: Several councils did not receive up-to-date Covid data for almost three weeks, the BBC learns.

title: Baby death raises questions over maternity care
description: Parents Beth and Dan Wankiewicz are looking for answers over the death of their son Clay last year.

title: Third dose of Covid jab to be trialled in UK
description: The findings will help scientific advisers decide if re-vaccinating people in the autumn is necessary.

title: NI Covid-19 vaccine booking opens for 25-29 group
description: Early indications show uptake for bookings is high among the age group, the Department of Health says.

title: Covid: Government criticised over pre-pandemic planning
description: Ministers failed to prepare for a threat on the scale of the pandemic, the spending watchdog says.

title: Covid: WHO urges Wales to delay giving children jabs
description: Wales asked to donate vaccines to low-income countries by the World Health Organization.

title: 296 people donate organs in first year of new consent law
description: Max and Keira's Law presumes all adults in England as potential organ donors unless they opt out.

title: Unpublished hospital patient safety reports exposed
description: BBC Panorama finds dozens of reports into concerns over hospital services have not been made public.

title: Vaccinating children before poor morally wrong, Oxford scientist says
description: Oxford vaccine leader Prof Andrew Pollard says adults in poorer countries should be protected first.

title: India Covid: Dying mother's final message
description: Dimple Arora was a 34 year-old-dentist with everything to live for when she died of Covid-19.

title: Severely ill - and still made to quarantine in a hotel
description: The law says some severely ill are exempt from hotel quarantine - but they don't always get a choice.

title: Covid Indian variant: Where is it, how does it spread and is it more infectious?
description: B.1.617.2 is dominant in some parts of the country - but it doesn't have to be cause for panic yet.

title: Covid-19 vaccines: Why some African states can't use their vaccines
description: African countries have struggled to get vaccines, but some now plan to throw away thousands of doses.

title: India coronavirus: Tracing a family’s journey to save a life
description: A family's heartbreaking journey between two cities to find a bed for a gasping Covid-19 patient.

title: 'My exhausting smear test battle'
description: Transgender men, such as Laurie, are not automatically contacted for potentially life-saving smear tests.

title: How many cases in your area?
description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

title: What are the India, Brazil, South Africa and UK variants?
description: In some parts of the UK coronavirus cases are rising due to a variant from India that spreads more easily.

title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
description: Lockdown restrictions will ease in Northern Ireland, following rule changes in England, Scotland and Wales

description: Shielding in England is ending on 31 March.

description: Why experts are concerned about the emergence of this particular new version of coronavirus.

title: Coronavirus: What it does to the body
description: What is it like to have the coronavirus, how will it affect you and how is it treated?

title: Support bubbles: How do they work and who is in yours?
description: Some people across the UK have been able to form "support bubbles" or "extended households".

title: How to get a Covid test
description: Everyone in England and Scotland is being encouraged to take rapid coronavirus tests regularly.

title: All you need to know on the coronavirus

title: Coronavirus: Intensive care and other key terms explained
description: Use our tool to check the meaning of key words and phrases associated with the Covid-19 outbreak.

title: Coronavirus: What is the risk to men over 50?
description: While most people will have mild symptoms and recover quickly, some are more prone to getting sick.

title: Coronavirus: Do face masks actually work?

title: Covid Vaccines: Could they be magnetic?
description: Videos of people sticking magnets to their arms where they claim they’ve had the Covid vaccine have gone viral. We debunk this so-called magnet challenge.

title: Lord Coe pleads for resumption of weekly community event Parkrun
description: World Athletics president Lord Coe says Parkrun is a crucial public health initiative.
